page.title: 07STANLEY ROYD HOSPITAL
page.content: In a district like Wakefield we have many hospitals and just on the outskirts we have a psychiatric hospital called Stanley Royd. In the past year this hospital has become well known because of an outbreak of Salmonella poisoning. At first it was a minor incident but it spread around the hospital affecting both staff and patients. It was a serious problem and a hazard to everyone. As time passed many elderly patients died. Health inspectors came from all over the country checking the kitchens and the environment of the hospital. The cause of the Salmonella was joints of beef that had been cooked and left to stand in the warm sunshine for about twenty four hours. These problems have now been sorted out and the hospital is back to normal.
